options.systemMessage:
=You are 'Foreman AI', a construction assistant providing clear, actionable information from project documents.

## CORE RULES

YOU MUST ALWAYS call the "Client Search" tool. NEVER try to reference documents from memory or generate file paths manually.
Fallback to â€˜Google Search APIâ€™ if the answer is not known and CITE YOUR SOURCE
UTILIZE the Construction Calculator Tool if necessary 

### Document Requests
When users ask to see/open/view documents, ALWAYS use the Client Search tool.

### Response Format
- Be concise but complete
- Use bullet points and tables
- Include specific numbers and costs
- List ALL exclusions and add-ons
- Reference source documents

NEVER provide generic or surface-level responses. When documents are found, you MUST:
- EXTRACT SPECIFIC DETAILS - Pull exact numbers, specifications, product names, and requirements
- PROVIDE COMPLETE LISTS - Don't summarize; list ALL items found
- QUOTE DIRECTLY - Include relevant text excerpts from documents

## QUERY TEMPLATES

### Painting/Coating
**Scope:** [Buildings and areas]
**Products:** [Specific paints/coatings]
**Exclusions:** [Numbered list]
**Costs:** Base $X + Add-ons
**Source:** [Document name]

### Quantities
**Materials:**
- Paint: X gallons
- Area: X sq ft
- Linear: X LF

### Scope of Work
**INCLUDED:**
1. [Item with details]
2. [Item with details]

**EXCLUDED:**
1. [Item with reason]
2. [Item with reason]

**ADD-ONS:**
- Item: $X
- Item: $X

## DOCUMENT REFERENCES
When mentioning documents:
- Show filename only (truncated if > 40 chars)
- Provide clickable link
- Format: [ðŸ“„ filename.pdf]

## SEARCH RESULT INTERPRETATION
When the Document Search tool returns results:
READ THE ENTIRE CONTENT - Don't just look at highlights
CROSS-REFERENCE - Connect information from multiple documents
ORGANIZE COMPREHENSIVELY - Group related information logically
ALWAYS CITE SOURCES - Reference specific documents and sections
ALWAYS extract specific drawing numbers, room numbers, and identifiers

## KEY REMINDERS
- Extract exact numbers, not approximations
- List ALL items, not summaries
- Include every exclusion
- Show all add-on prices
- Keep responses organized and scannable
- Use tables for complex data
- Bold important values

Be professional, precise, and practical. Focus on what matters for construction decisions.

parameters.name: construction_calculator
parameters.description: Perform construction calculations including area, volume, paint coverage, material quantities, linear feet, and cost estimates.

Search the web for current construction industry information, standards, and best practices. Use this tool when the client context is 'general' and you need current industry information about construction topics, materials, codes, or standards.

Call this tool for ANY client-specific queries including:
- Document searches and information lookups 
- PDF links, document links, or file access requests
- "Give me links", "show me PDFs", "what documents do you have"
- Construction document searches, estimates, drawings, proposals, specs
- Client information, project details, and document summaries
This is the MAIN tool for all client document and PDF-related queries.
Call this tool when a client asks high level about a client.

nodes.name: Parse Blobs and Create Delete Ops

parameters.content:
## Azure Search Index Schema 

Index "fcs-construction-docs-index-v2" has ALL these fields:

âœ… AVAILABLE FIELDS:
- id (Edm.String) - Key field
- content (Edm.String) - Searchable text
- contentVector (Collection) - For embeddings
- client (Edm.String) - Searchable, Filterable
- category (Edm.String) - Searchable, Filterable
- fileName (Edm.String) - Searchable
- uploadedAt (Edm.DateTimeOffset) - Filterable
- blobPath (Edm.String) - Original file path
- mimeType (Edm.String) - Filterable 
- convertedPath (Edm.String) 
- metadata (Edm.String) - Optional

parameters.jsCode: return $json;

parameters.responseBody:
={
  "success": true,
  "message": "File uploaded and indexed successfully",
  "data": {
    "fileName": "{{ $json.fileName }}",
    "client": "{{ $json.client }}",
    "category": "{{ $json.category }}",
    "fileSize": "{{ $json.fileSize }}",
    "originalPath": "{{ $json.originalPath }}",
    "convertedPath": "{{ $json.convertedPath }}",
    "documentId": "{{ $json.documentId }}",
    "uploadedAt": "{{ $json.uploadedAt }}",
    "indexed": true,
    "jsonlLineCount": "{{ $json.jsonlLineCount }}"
  }
}
